documentType: search warrant application and supporting affidavit
summary: This document is an FBI agent's affidavit and application for a search warrant for a property in Bradford, New Hampshire, to locate and arrest Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the probable cause for her arrest on charges related to the sexual exploitation of minors with Jeffrey Epstein and presents evidence (cell phone data, property records) that she is hiding at the specified location. The document includes the sealed indictment and arrest warrant as exhibits.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary target of the investigation and search warrant. She is charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury related to facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as Maxwell's co-conspirator in the sexual abuse of minor girls. The affidavit states Maxwell assisted, facilitated, and contributed to his abuse of minors.

persons.name: Andrea K. Johnstone
persons.context: Signed the search warrant, the cell-site simulator warrant, and the motion to seal for the District of New Hampshire. She attested to the telephonic affidavit.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: Signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020, in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: Signed the warrant for cellphone location information (Cell Site Warrant) for the Target Cellphone on June 30, 2020.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An attorney who represented Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. The Target Cellphone was in contact with a phone subscribed in her name.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge before whom Laura Menninger appeared for oral argument on Maxwell's behalf in June 2020.

connections.description: Described as co-conspirators in a scheme to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls. Maxwell was his close associate, intimate partner, and property manager.
Laura Menninger is identified as an attorney who represented Maxwell in civil litigation. The Target Cellphone was in contact with a phone in Menninger's name.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant Issued
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury. U.S. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed an arrest warrant for Maxwell.

events.title: Cell-Site Simulator Pinpoints Maxwell's Phone
events.description: A cell-site simulator confirmed that the Target Cellphone (believed to be used by Maxwell) was located at the Subject Premises (338 East Washington Road, Bradford, NH) at approximately 7:36 AM.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested in July 2019. The affidavit states that after this, Maxwell intentionally sought to evade detection.

events.title: Maxwell's Perjurious Deposition Testimony
events.description: During a deposition under oath, Ghislaine Maxwell gave false testimony, including denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and denying she gave massages.

events.title: Purchase of Subject Premises
events.description: Granite Realty LLC purchased the 156-acre property at 338 East Washington Road, Bradford, NH for $1,070,000 in an all-cash sale.

locations: 338 East Washington Road, Bradford, New Hampshire 03221
Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
keyFacts: The FBI used a cell-site simulator on July 2, 2020, to pinpoint Ghislaine Maxwell's cellphone at a 156-acre property in Bradford, New Hampshire, leading to the search warrant application for her arrest.

Maxwell was charged with conspiracy, enticement, and transportation of minors related to facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of girls as young as 14, and with perjury for false 2016 deposition testimony.

After Epstein's July 2019 arrest, Maxwell engaged in extensive efforts to evade detection, including moving, using a new cellphone registered to 'G Max', and having packages delivered under another person's name.

The New Hampshire property was purchased in December 2019 for $1.07 million in cash by 'Granite Realty LLC', an entity the affidavit suggests was used to obscure ownership, consistent with Maxwell's evasion efforts.

The affidavit references three minor victims (Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) and details Maxwell's alleged methods of grooming, which included befriending, normalizing sexual topics, giving massages, and being present during abuse.
